DWP Declares General Political Strike
articles.content:
DWP Declares General Political Strike 
    Pyongyang, March 3 (KCNA) -- The representative of the Democratic Workers' Party held an urgent press conference on Feb. 28 at which he declared a general political strike, according to the south Korean KBS.
 He charged that the "bill on part-time job" railroaded through the "Environment and Labor Committee of the National Assembly" on Feb. 27 is an evil law inviting misfortune, stating that his party would do its utmost to prevent the passage of the bill through the session of the NA.    
 He also declared that all members of his party and members of the south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions would stage a strike against the NA passage of the bill at each work place and hold a rally in Seoul soon to vow to struggle against it.

GNP Clan Assailed for Reckless Remarks
articles.content:
GNP Clan Assailed for Reckless Remarks 
    Pyongyang, March 3 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Federation of University Student Councils reportedly issued a statement on February 27, denouncing clan of the Grand National Party for their reckless remarks against the DPRK and reunification.
 The statement said that former spokesperson of the GNP Jon Ryo Ok desecrated the June 15 joint declaration on February 22 and former president of the GNP Ri Hoe Chang openly accused inter-Korean reconciliation and cooperation.
 Their reckless remarks are the last-ditch efforts of those who have been driven into an abyss by the daily growing desire of the people for independent reunification and developing inter-Korean relations after the publication of the joint declaration, the statement said, stressing: 
 The GNP is unpardonable for its past crimes only. If the GNP continues to act against reunification as now, its result is very clear.    
 The traitorous party is bound to stand trial.    
 The GNP should sincerely apologize to the nation for its past crimes and treacherous actions before dismantling itself at once.

Korean Jewel Picture
articles.content:
Korean Jewel Picture 
    Pyongyang, March 3 (KCNA) -- The Korean jewel picture, a new kind of fine arts created in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, has steadily developed, greatly contributing to  the socialist cultural construction.
 Its first work was created in Juche 76 (1987). As yet, such kind of fine art has not been created in other countries.    
 The Korean jewel picture is drawn with natural stone powder of various colors on the basis of the creative techniques of the Korean painting, the national fine art.
 Its color is soft to appreciate and remains unchanged. It can depict humans, animals and beautiful natural phenomena delicately on a high artistic level.
 There are many works of national treasure value. Typical of them are "Dove Dance ", "Snow Falls", "Tiger in Mt. Paektu" and "Sobaek Stream in Summer".
 The creative technique of the Korean jewel picture is applied to the creation of huge fine art works today.    
 Korean jewel pictures were awarded gold medals and diplomas at the 88 Beijing international patent exhibition held in China in October Juche 77 (1988) and other international shows and fairs.

articles.title: Pyongyang Jujube, High-grade Strain
articles.content:
Pyongyang Jujube, High-grade Strain
    Pyongyang, March 3 (KCNA) -- Pyongyang Jujube trees have been cultivated in different areas of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
 It was bred from a species of wild jujube trees growing in mountainous areas of the country by researchers of the Central Botanical Garden some years back.
 Each Pyongyang jujube is five grams heavier on the average and sweeter than Tokdong Jujube and Pongsan Jujube which have been famous in the country from olden times.
 The tree shoots out more branches and has big crown as against its height, compared with other species of jujube trees. It bears first fruits 3-4 years after its plantation. It, with no thorns, is good for garden.    
 The researchers also developed the method of mass-propagating the trees.
 The rate of rooting of the Pyongyang jujube saplings is above 95 percent. And it is possible to nurse saplings without any big investment.
